data.event: Dale was formerly on the alignment of the Seaboard Air Line Railroad's Carolina Division low-level main line, constructed from 1915 and opened December 31, 1917.
Dale was formerly on the alignment of the Seaboard Air Line Railroad's Carolina Division low-level main line, constructed from 1915 and opened December 31, 1917.

event.title: was abandoned by stages, with the first portion removed north of Dale, between Lobeco and Charleston, after October 1, 1967

data.event: The "East Carolina Subdivision", as it was colloquially called, was abandoned by stages, with the first portion removed north of Dale, between Lobeco and Charleston, after October 1, 1967.

event.title: removed between Coosaw and Pritchardville, south of Dale, in 1978

data.event: Following the April 21, 1971 destruction of the old SAL lift bridge over the Savannah River by a ship in foggy conditions, the southern connection into Savannah was cut and the rail line removed between Coosaw and Pritchardville, south of Dale, in 1978.
Most of the remaining line was lifted in 1982.
